channel.title: Purple/Black Checkers after -dxlevel 90
channel.description:
Hello. I'm seeing the purple/black checker issue with almost all the textures in Black Mesa. I followed Flarekitsu's advise and entered "-dxlevel 90" in my start up options, but it has not made a difference. Any advise would be appreciated.
My System:
ASRock 970 Extreme3 3.10 gigahertz AMD FX-8120 Eight-Core NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 Windows 7 Ultimate (x64) Service Pack 1 (build 7601) 16 GB RAM

item.title: Purple/Black Checkers after -dxlevel 90
item.dc:creator: Jenova19
item.description:
Try this:

[i]

  1. Add “-dxlevel 98” instead of “-dxlevel 90”
  2. Launch the game
  3. Quit the game after it loaded into the menu
  4. Remove “-dxlevel 98” from the launch options
  5. Play!

[/i]

Thanks to lexa2 for explaining it to me earlier!
